ygData.subject: Re: Lanys T'yvl...
ygData.msgSnippet: Reminds me of my start in EQ. I spent the better part of the first night trying to get a name through the the approval process. In my frustration, I made a
ygData.messageBody:
Reminds me of my start in EQ. I spent the better
part of the first night trying to get a name through
the the approval process. In my frustration, I made a
female character and tried. I got the name approved on
the first try. I was just elated to get into the game
that I didn't care what I was. As for gifts, she
didn't get any. Didn't matter to me either. Later on,
she was given some nice items that were good into her
low teens. A friend said that I was only given those
items because I was playing a female. So I bet him that
he was wrong.<br>I went and created a male half elf
warrior in Freeport. Within 5 minutes of appearing in the
city, I was approached and asked if I was a good
person. I said yes. I was then given a minotaur bp and a
2handed sword (either lammy or langsaxe, can't remember
which). I did not beg nor ask for anything. I considered
myself lucky. My friend was p.o'd though. hehe<br>As for
me, if I have extra and feel like it, and haven't
been hounded for stuff, I do give things away.
Sometimes I ask for minor things in return, like a
spiderling silk or bat wing. <br>My warrior who has mainly
war only stuff or no drop, is always hit for items. I
had to ask one guy (7th level dwarf cleric in
Rivervale) what part of warrior only did he not
understand?<br>Bottom line (for me) Beg and ye shall get naught. Be
kind and I may loosen my bank doors.<br><br>Timmye
Cousteau<br>29th Druid (not Anon nor Role)
